techmeme.title: DoorDash reports Q2 revenue up 23% YoY to $2.63B vs. $2.54B est., total orders up 19% YoY to $635M, and forecasts Q3 adjusted EBITDA above expectations (Granth Vanaik/Reuters)
Intel Q2: revenue down 1% YoY to $12.8B, vs. $12.9B est., Data Center and AI down 3% to $3B; announces $10B cost reduction plan, including cutting 15% of staff (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
Amazon reports Q2 revenue up 10% YoY to $148B, a $13.5B net income, vs. $6.7B YoY, $14.7B operating income, vs. $7.7B YoY, subscription sales up 10% to $10.9B (Amazon.com, Inc.)
Morpho, a decentralized lending developer, raised $50M led by Ribbit Capital, after raising an undisclosed sum earlier in 2024, and $18M in 2022 (MK Manoylov/The Block)
Rabbit says a June security breach was caused by an employee who leaked API keys and has since been terminated, and it has revoked and rotated those API keys (Jason Koebler/404 Media)
